website_summaries.verdict: As far as bone conduction technology goes, this MP3 player is your best option. However, quality and reliability have been an issue.
pros: Sound quality is impeccable for an underwater device
Excellent battery life with a 4GB memory capacity
Fits over the cheekbones so you don’t have to put anything in the ears
cons: Quality control seems to be lacking
Some units work great while others give out after only a few weeks or months

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: If you report a connection problem and your unit is out of warranty they will tell you "it has worn out, we can sell you a new unit at a discount." They won't even give you tips to fix the connectors. I followed the dip in CLR tip here and the unit is back to working condition. If the contacts wear you may also try to rebuild them as other reviewers stated here. Of course Finis will advise none of it, they stick by the "rub alcohol" theory which does not work and then they'll try to get you to spend money on a new unit
customer_reviews.author: bool

customer_reviews.title: My "new" Duo was very used
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust this product from Amazon. I purchased a "new" Duo and received it today. You can clearly see from the photos I uploaded that it has been used. It is scratched and even chipped in places. Thanks Amazon! UPDATE: I opted to have Amazon replace the item for a new one. The second one was used also! This one had similar scratches on the outside as though it was in someone's gym bag or purse for a while and it also had what looked like ear wax on the face side. <Shudder> I sent this one back also and got a refund this time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The  Best I’ve Been Able to Find So Far...
customer_reviews.text: Starting with the premise that there are NO great waterproof MP3/earbuds, I purchased these about two months ago and am happy with them. Why? Because they charge up easily/quickly, and they work. That said, the sound quality is mediocre (bass is almost nonexistent) and a bit tinny. I know they are supposed to be placed against the temples to be “bone-conducting,” but I tend to place mine almost directly over my ears to maximize both volume and sound consistency. Still searching for the perfect swim earbuds, but these will do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Synch hit or miss double check
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a pair of duo for over a year. Swim 3-5 times or not a week. 3000 yds a day minimum. Love mine. Have experienced some problems with getting music to synch at times. Showed up on computer screen music is there but actually not on the players when get to gym. So it’s hit or miss with them while loading music. Just double check the players before leaving to the gym. I’d be lost without mine. Need to remember water and electronic don’t mix very well so it’s not going to be spot on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kent

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the worse swim player I've ever tried. It's really easy to load your music but the sound quality is atrocious. There's absolutely NO bass, just high pitched and scratchy treble. And the change in tone every time you lift your head out of the water is annoying. I've tried four different types of swim players over the last ten years and these are at the bottom. Sending them back. going to get another SYRYN player. The red one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. BiggySmall

customer_reviews.title: Unique, works, a little funky
customer_reviews.text: There's not really software for this - you have to put mp3 files on it like it was a flash drive. It could use a better interface. Also your mask has to have a narrow band to fit into the clips on this thing. It is a unique approach, with bone-conduction sound that works really well under water. I just wish the computer interface were a bit more worked out - I found it pretty clunky to use.
customer_reviews.author: billfish

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: Very. Very. Very. Impressed with these. I was VERY SKEPTICAL. I must say though. This appears to be a well made product. My buddy had even been dying to get a pair. The under water sounds it's crystal clear. I thought others might be able to hear the music when I was out of the water because it sounded so loud. But no one can heat or but you. It's amazing! I am very much enjoying these so far. I bought them about 3 weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality if you can keep it from falling off
customer_reviews.text: This product is one of the better bone conduction in the market. I’ve tried others and in terms of sound quality this does a better job. But that is if it stays on right. It’s harder to keep on right compared to others I’ve tried. There’s quite a lot of variability with fit depending on the goggles you use. This product could be much better if there was a better solution for the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: Nice underwater headphones for playing music while doing laps. Sound quality not as rich as AudioPool (no longer in business). Sounds a bit tinny, but good enough to keep me swimming 40 laps non-stop. Let’s see if this lasts as long as my MP3 AudioPool. So far, very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: SAVER

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, stupid design flaws.
customer_reviews.text: These sound great under water - much better than in-ear headphones - but have some stupid design flaws: 1. The slots for the goggle straps are way too narrow for most goggle straps. 2. The setup of the control buttons is ridiculous; the plus(+) arrow increases the volume (via a long press) but sends the music BACK a track (via a short press), and the minus(-) arrow decreases the volume but sends the music track forward! Who came up with this design, and why did anyone else approve it?!?! I'm keeping them because they seem to be the best underwater headphones available, but I'm rather annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: returned it
customer_reviews.text: Too complicated to get Itunes music on it. Yes, I understood how, but since you can't easily export any playlist to it, and you have to check each SONG for compatibility, it's just not reasonable. It charged just fine but I just didn't want the hassle of choosing and checking 4gb of songs one by one...who would? I'm sure it's a great item but not for Itunes lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love music while swimming but got a used one! Angry!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for one that I have been using for a couple years. The wire had pulled out a bit on my old one similar to other comments and I covered it with electrician tape. But overall I really enjoy it and enjoy music with my laps. However, the one I received as “NEW” is obviously USED. Marks and scratches all over the buttons. I was suspicious when it was not a sealed package. Will look for another one from a reputable supplier! Very irritated!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kathleen Schwarting

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: From MP3 1G, to MP3 2G, to Neptune and now Duo. Finis can always make a worse player. The device is thick. Maybe it will work with future goggles, but not with the available ones. You also need to connect it to the goggles before you put the goggles on. It takes time. The sound is good - but you will not be able to swim wearing them. Waste of money, waste of time. Please, just produce MP3 1G again!
customer_reviews.author: Weiser

customer_reviews.title: Soaking in CLR solution works!
customer_reviews.text: Yes like many users my Finis had connection issues due to corrosion after several months of use. I followed the example of a fellow reviewer and soaked it in CLR to remove the corrosion. I had to use a screwdriver to do some final scraping, but sure enough, the Finis launched again on my desktop. So it's back in business for now. Thank-you for providing a solution. I love the product but it has its design challenges for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chanda Smith

customer_reviews.title: *This* version works fluently!
customer_reviews.text: I had the light grey and teal colored one before and what you see for the 1-Star reviews are completely justified - for the old version! I had that one and it still kinda works in that I can charge it but it's not recognized as a data storage device. This new one is different. I've have had it for a long time, I want to say almost a year and it's still going. It is clearly recognized by the computer and it charges perfectly. This one is magnetized like the Mac Power Cable, the old one with the pins had difficulty getting the right connection.
customer_reviews.author: Noneatallhere

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have owned previous generations of this product; and even though I have had a problems with a couple of them in the past, or the product just wore out because of being in the water (despite being treated in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions) - this is the FIRST time I have had problems with a product so quickly. After charging it the first time as per the instruction manual, and ONE usage; the product will not NOT allow me to charge it again. This comes after taking the time to convert my music into MP3 format, and then load it on the device, I now have to return it for a refund. Not good.....
customer_reviews.author: Desert Cdn

customer_reviews.title: Underwater Music Player
customer_reviews.text: I love the player. This is my second jaw bone of this brand, though not this model. Unfortunately it does not clip on to my goggles as the first model did. This has to have the goggle band threaded through the head set. I wear this model at the back of my head behind my ear canals and hear beautifully. I cannot give it a 5 due to the difficulty programming the player and the difficulty changing the sound track while wearing. I really would give it a 3.5 but would buy it again for the excellent sound system.
customer_reviews.author: rlw257271

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is pretty good....great if I wear ear plugs. Product indicates that it's compatible with iTunes. Not really. The Duo requires .mp3 or .wav files. While I could convert some of my songs to mp3 directly in iTunes, others couldn't be converted because they were in a protected format. For those, I had to burn to an audio CD and then rip it back to my computer to get it into the correct format. I had the underwater iPod which I also liked, but the only earbuds that didn't fall out hurt when I put my swim cap over my ears.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but lifetime of unit not great
customer_reviews.text: I like this company but I wish their mp3 units lasted longer. I swim semi-regularly but not a lot by any means and I am lucky if I get 2 years out of their products. 5 stars for design and functionality. 2-3 stars for quality over time considering one of pricier units on market.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Donner

customer_reviews.title: Connecting to PC or/and charging is very problematic. Sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for 4 years, and I used it 1 or 2 times per week for swimming. The sound quality is great. Much better than anything else I tried in the past. Unfortunately the docking technology/quality is very poor. I struggled since the very beginning with the uploading of music and recharging of the battery. After 4 years it stop working (which is not necessarily bad). I am disappointed that Finis did nothing to improve this product with all the complaints they received pointing out to the same issue. In summary, 5 for sound, 1 for connectivity/charging quality. I am going to buy it again, as I do not see any better alternatives out there.
customer_reviews.author: Emilia F.

customer_reviews.title: This product has never performed as promised
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I got this product, I've had problems with it. I contacted their tech support 3 times and each time they told me to try a few tests and report to them...all tests seemed to fail to perform, and yet they refuse to send me a replacement unit...I don't understand how they can stay in business if their support is subpar...
customer_reviews.author: Richard Paige

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the sound and love swimming with music
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 Finis Neptunes and now the new Duo. I am happy with the sound and love swimming with music. HOWEVER, the Duo magnetic connection with the USB cable is terrible and now I cannot get the unit to mount on Mac desktop to access the files and add/delete. I can get it to charge but not to mount. Have tried everything including C-clamps and twist ties. Have tried on 2 different Macs, both with current software updates. It is very frustrating that after just recently paying $100 I cannot add or change any music on the device. Any help or advice would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Briggs

customer_reviews.title: swim mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: It s my 3rd one . last one lasted bought 2 years .. longer than others..The biggest problem is charging them..after while the conections get build up on them..I d scrub with tooth brush and alcohol. I d all so use a dental pick to scrap them...These new ones I gona try soaking them in a solution I read about in noe of reviews
customer_reviews.author: jedma

customer_reviews.title: I loved it until it broke -
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, because I love to swim with music and the bone conduction is really great. Unfortunately, these are designed so poorly that this second pair stopped working almost immediately- probably the third time using them. And I babied them. Finis sent me another pair that didn't work at all, which I mailed back months ago. After repeated attempts to contact the company (Case #36964) I remain without underwater headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Earls

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to "in the ear" swim headphones
customer_reviews.text: Son wanted this for Christmas, and was really concerned about the reviews. Our daughter has a set (over a year now) and has never had any problems. Took the plunge, and our set arrived quickly and has been great. No problems with charging, or downloading songs from iTunes. Really wanted a set he didn't have to wear in his ears. Only used a few months, but great so far. Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mean

customer_reviews.title: Update! Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the wires pulling out of the paddles. I contacted customer service and the responded right away and sent me a replacement. Great company and a great product. I wanted to be able to listen to music while swimming laps, I want to wear earplugs because I hate it when I have water in my ears. This works great. I found that adjusting the volume can be tricky but once you get it set it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned two other pairs of swimming earphones both of which would always have water in my ear regardless of the ear adapter so I bought these. what I like about them is that they’re stable and I can hear the music granted it’s not as loud but I can still hear it without having to manipulate my ear and stop to get the water out
customer_reviews.author: Earl Styles

customer_reviews.title: Bone conduction works well for swimming
customer_reviews.text: One of the few bone conduction waterproof music players. Sound quality is very good for swimming. No type of waterproof earbuds ever stayed in my ears when swimming - this solves the problem. Controls somewhat counter-intuitive but build is solid and battery life is more than adequate for two one+ hour workouts. Never pushed it beyond that so I don't know if it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan W.

customer_reviews.title: Music while swimming
customer_reviews.text: If I did not have my techy spouse here to help me, I would not have been able to figure out how to convert songs to MP3. Other than that, it’s fabulous to be able to listen to music while swimming laps for an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. The interface is a little clunky (alphabetical only), and you have to charge it frequently, but in the pool it is great. I love not having something in my ears and the sound is surprisingly good. I wonder if the neighbors can hear sometimes, but no one claims to hear it as long as it is touching skin. My first charger broke, but finis sent a new one immediately and so far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: I have received this item used two times from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept but I have ordered twice this product. The first time I have received a unit all scratched and the magnet re-glued, obviously used. The second time after I returned the first unit, I received a unit all charged and with music. Obviously used. The manufacturers tried to push the product to new buyers even when it is used and you pay for a new one. Disappointed, very disappointed. I used many other products from FINIS, no complains about them, but this one is no BUENO.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos M. Cobian

customer_reviews.title: Caution alert
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time user of the Finis Duo (and preceding iterations). And they're great when they work. But lately I've experienced a serious lowering of its usable life. The previous one I bought only lasted about 5 months. I was peeved but after a while I bought another one. The most recent one lasted less than a month! It's too expensive for me to be buying a new one every month. Oh, and their online support wasn't really any help at all.
customer_reviews.author: Darshan Khalsa

customer_reviews.title: Battery failed after second charge
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth Finis swim mp3 product in the past 10-12 years and the second one that failed quickly. Most last about 2-3 years. It charged successfully the first time, then once more. The third time it never completed charging (no solid green light) and when turned on, failed after two seconds indicating no charge. Currently contacting Finis to replace. They did quickly replace the other one that failed (about five years ago). When it works, it's a great swim Mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: asdamazon

customer_reviews.title: Duo stops loading and finis customer service will not refund or exchange
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely particular about proper handling of the unit. I rinse the device and clean the contacts after each use. I have had three duos and every one of them stopped loading, charging or playing after about 4-6 months of three times per week pool use. The leads fracture and the posts on the charging connector break off. When its working it is fine but most of the time they won't charge, load or play. I bought mine from Amazon who referred me to Finis for return who referred me back to Amazon. Terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: joan christie

customer_reviews.title: Better sound quality than the previous model
customer_reviews.text: 12/16: Better sound quality than the previous model, less cumbersome. Awesome to swim to music, inspires to swim longer and to the beat!. Hope to not have the same issues as with previous SwimP3, not being recognized by PC, stop working, not charging. The ear pods are much better than ear plug models\ 5/17: as expected, and as happens with all their SwimP3's, it has now stopped working! After only 4 months. When it is operational, it is great. let's see if Finis customer sx is as reliable as has been in past and that they will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Soliera

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound even when swimming fast.
customer_reviews.text: The Finns MP3 player is very comfortable, and I had no issues with my goggles leaking, or the player coming loose in flip turn. I bought the recommended ear plugs to keep the water out of the ears. My goggles are larger than the average swim goggles as you can see in the picture “Aqua Sphere”. Setup is a snap, no software to install it just shows up as a USB drive , and you copy your files to it. I rinse the charging contacts after every swim with fresh water to keep them from corroding from the chlorine. I have about 20 miles of swimming with no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Rich l

customer_reviews.title: I like these.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Better than trying to keep my ear buds in. I use earplugs to help so th hearing them when out of the water. I always rinse with fresh water, then blow the contacts dry.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 4G Duo does not last
customer_reviews.text: Use while lap swimming. I had two 2G models previously that lasted longer. This one only 18 months of occasional use. Reset worked once until I got to the pool. Charged, but no sound, no "on" indicator flash either.
customer_reviews.author: redngary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound.  Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy any other product for swimming. this is the one you need! I Have been using this for years and recently had to buy another. You may spend a little more but It’s well worth it. Fits comfortably and the sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: CCPopper

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: I've kept with this company for years because the sound quality is so good, but now I've finally given up. The units work for a few months, and then they stop charging or they can't be recognized by any of several laptops when I want to add music. It's very, very disappointing. Is this due to uneven manufacturing quality? For $104, I expect better. After 4 purchases, I have given up.
customer_reviews.author: riverside

customer_reviews.title: The wire became exposed and the apparatus got very hot!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality of this and have ordered several in the past - the last one lasting 2 years before the clips finally broke off. However, after only 1 month of use (and careful use!), I noted that the wire was exposed after the product started to get very hot on one of my ears during a work-out. This was extremely scary. I immediately took off the product and discarded it. Just wanted to make sure that no one got electrocuted or injured from this product and what to look for!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Is $100 for three months worth it?
customer_reviews.text: When these worked, I loved them. They would pull your goggles a bit during turns but they worked well for me. After about 3 months of swimming (about 25 swims), they quit working in the middle of the swim. I thought they didn't charge right, so I put them on the charger base and immediately heard a sizzling sound. They had let water in and are now useless. I guess these things last on average right around 3 months and the company has no sense of responsibilty for selling a crappy product. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have had two or three of these.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and ease of use is great. I've had a couple of problems with the device. In one a cable cracked and the wire inside was exposed; in another there was a problem with the charging connection. I use them quite a bit so I not surprised by these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald C. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Clearly the BEST swimming headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These swimming headphones are the BEST! So worth the money! I have tried other ones that don't stay on my ear, or water gets in the canal or the tube gets kinked somehow. The finis headphones might look a little different but if you are a regular swimmer and want no-nonsense, plug and play music enjoyment... this is the way to go. I have recommended them to other swimmers and they love them too. Again, don't waste time or money on other mp3 headphones. Buy finis today!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bell

customer_reviews.title: Makes laps less boring.
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to review, but works well so far. Had last pair for years. Only mp3 that you can swim and actually listen to books. I cover the charging connection with wax ear plug to keep from getting build up.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Turpin

customer_reviews.title: 111% junk
customer_reviews.text: Excited and hopeful for this. Was unable to get any of the usb ports on two computers to recognize it. However, all those same usb ports are able to recognize other devices and drives. So, couldn't even give this a try. And, if its that poor quality right out of the box, I am unwilling to waste more energy and and time in a replacement. Say if a replacement worked, for 5 months, what then. I should have heeded my initial feelings from the myriad of other poor reviews about this, but I was optimistic. ***Beware bored lap swimmers, this probably isn't the solution***
customer_reviews.author: Derek Pistoll

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Only works under the water. Fine freestyle with my snorkel but doesn't work doing backstroke or treading water.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bowden

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic. Stop waiting. Do it.
customer_reviews.text: Do you swim? get this. DO IT. Sound is clear. Connecting to PC is easy to update. Can't hear it from more than a few feet away in the water so you're not bothering anyone. Fits on the goggles all sorts of ways ( I wear it upside down, at the base of my skull behind each ear.) Bonus: Helps keep swim cap on and hair a bit dryer, but that might just be me.
customer_reviews.author: Thuendermans

customer_reviews.title: They just aren't made to last
customer_reviews.text: I've had several (at least 5) since they've hit the market. I like bone conduction best. And this is excellent concept but poor execution for the price. For the price it should last twice as long or just be about $50. I've learned to lap without music
customer_reviews.author: Yada Yada

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound for a swim. Had one before wire broke after 5 years or so this is my 2nd!
customer_reviews.text: I swim 6 days a week. It is so relaxing almost like meditation to listen to music while swimming. Can't get the full experience without blocking out the noise. With the Finis Duo all I hear is the music I love in perfect clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Never worked once
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for swimming. One of the pins that connects to the headphones for charging was bent upon arrival so I never could charge the device or add music. If it’s this finicky before being in the water, one can imagine what chlorinated water does to them. Too bad, I was really excited about the capabilities of this device but not enough attention was paid to the design.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Weber

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just wiring redesign suggested
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FINIS Duo 2 headset, intending to use them for training. I’ve only recently started using them. They’re a great concept, and a welcome addition to the long seasons I do in training. I’d like to make a suggestion, which I hope is constructive and not seen as an unnecessary complaint. Unfortunately my set is no longer working, and as the photo shows, the wiring connected to the headpiece is compromised and not connecting. Perhaps in future designs more reinforcement can be used for the wiring? Returning the unit isn’t possible as I’m in South Africa. Looking forward to the next edition.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Launder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good sound, lots of space and battery
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing! Exactly what I needed to keep my momentum up during swimming. I never have trouble hearing my music and the battery lasts for hours! It is extremely robust during my swim, no exact placement needed and is not touchy to a bump from my arm. The player automatically compresses the sound files to the size necessary for the quality of music it can produce so there is a lot more space on the player than I initially thought.
customer_reviews.author: Tosa228

customer_reviews.title: Died in a year- second one with short useful life
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first model of this and it lasted two years. BUT this one lasted only one season. I put it away in September and when I went to use it again it wont charge, or be recognized by the computer. It is dead. So their quality has nosedived and I will no longer buy this product. If anyone knows of a good underwater mp3 player other than this please post the suggestions. This is a zero.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Spade

customer_reviews.title: Go to the website and watch the tutorials on uploading the music
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product! It took some figuring to upload the music, but, the website tutorials made it easy to convert the music and get it uploaded and playing. Again outstanding product! Have been using it for a couple years now and it works as well as the day I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: mark rozecki

customer_reviews.title: Fragile unit that’s somewhat tempermental
customer_reviews.text: When they work they are very nice to have. The first pair I received wouldn’t ever turn on to play, all the lights came on but the device would freeze and then my laptop wouldn’t recognize the device. Got a replacement for the first pair and all seemed to work except for at times it still acted like it froze for a minute or two between commands. After 2 months now, the left side wiring loom is pulling out of the cheekbone unit exposing bare wires and undoubtably causing the popping/electrical short noises on that side of the unit. Works great when it works but is a very under built unit susceptible to damage.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I don't ever want to swim without music ever again.
customer_reviews.text: These things are fantastic. It took a bit of trial and error to figure out where to place them for optimal sound clarity. But once I found that "sweet spot" I was very pleased with the quality of sound. Haven't even had to charge them yet. Battery has performed for about 6 hours so far. And that just from a 30 minute swim every other day. I've enjoyed swimming in a completely new way now that I can bring my music in the water. Total game changer. You would be crazy not to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to Fail
customer_reviews.text: I used to like these players a lot, but I have gone through four of these units over the last two years and they just don't hold up. Inevitably, the sound will short out, sometimes through one channel (usually left) and sometimes through both. Once it breaks there is no warranty unless you catch it in time to return to Amazon. It appears to be a design flaw, as my original Finis player lasted five years before it broke. If you buy this it will fail; it's just a matter of time. They used to be good but no longer......
customer_reviews.author: Tom Garber

customer_reviews.title: The second set I purchased didn’t work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The first set I had was useful for my long training swims. They have to be placed at the right locations to hear them well. Thought I lost my first set when I moved house so I bought a second set. However the second set didn’t seem to work at all. As I put them aside when they arrived and only opened the box to try using them after some time and warranty might have been over, I did not write to their customer support
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good costumer service!
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months of use the wires were beginning. To separate .. I Sent an email to costumer support at Finis.. they asked me to email pics and proof of purchase. With in 2 weeks I got a new one in the mail. Would recommend this product. No trouble charging but I dry it and let it sit out to dry after use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Browne

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: Great for swimming laps! Works great as long as you take care of it: 1. Rinse and dry after each use. 2. Clean charging area with cotton swabs and rubbing alcohol as suggested by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Tech_Freak

customer_reviews.title: Beware Loose Wires
customer_reviews.text: Beware of wires coming loose on the earphones. And, a couple of days ago I noticed the wire connecting the ear pieces had actually split, prompting me to buy electrical tape. Then today, as I was about to charge the the Finis, I discovered the loose wires. This is my second Duo, the first a replacement for the Neptune. Docking can still be a problem. I love the Duo; if only the manufacturer took greater care and pride in product, it would be a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item hoping to listen to inspirational music while lap swimming that would help increase my pace. Concept seemed appropriate since it was not intended to be in your ears and attaches to your goggle strap. What a mistake though it was to purchase it. Simply put, it did not work. Never got to use it in the pool. It appeared to download music and charge up fully but would not stay on - it shuts itself off in a few seconds and doesn't play the music. Maybe it was a faulty individual item but I don't want to risk going through this again. Garbage. Don't recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great, easy to use. I’ve had this one for a few months now. My last one lasted for years. It would be nice if it had Bluetooth like some of its competitors. Overtime you do need to keep the contacts clean.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: One month of daily usage, working great buttons can be tricky
customer_reviews.text: Been using for one month, upload of music was easy even in ITunes. Sound quality when wearing silicone type ear plugs underwater is good but not Bose quality however you are swimming underwater. I strongly recommend these and have made swimming for exercise/weight loss something I'll stay with.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I will try again, but...
customer_reviews.text: numerous reviews are correct- my unit played for about 30 seconds, and as soon as I tried increasing volume it went dead. it won't reboot following instructions finis says, it won't charge, turn on or anything else. my computer won't recognize it either. It never even touched water. Thought I got lucky as putting songs was so easy and initially charged ok. So at $90 for unit, it comes out to just under $4000 per hour for music....Finis has some work to do putting some quality into their control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!  Take the boredom out of swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: I have used several other brands and types of headphones for swimming. These are absolutely the best! Excellent clarity and they are so loud I have to use the lowest setting. The controls are easy to use. No problems loading music or audio files. The think I like the most is I can use my own earplugs these transmit the sound through your temples. The battery life is great and they charge fast. The thing I recommend is that you use goggles with a single wide strap and not the two small straps.
customer_reviews.author: drpepperbaman

customer_reviews.title: WIRE IS COMING OFF!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Finis Duo in November 2018, and received it on the first week of December. I use it for half an hour a day, strictly following the care instructions. On February 11, I noticed that the wire that connects to one of the earpieces is hanging by a thread! I am scared to continue using this as it might cause harm or damage. This is after TWO MONTHS ONLY. I've gotten in touch with Finis helpline three times already in the past couple of days but have received error messages. So...either they don't want me to send these photos to them or this batch SUCKS. Either way, THIS IS HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer service and product
customer_reviews.text: Great product but had to get a new one in 4 months due to the wiring issue. Company sent me a replacement at no charge. Finis has Excellent customer service! I bought another one because I love it while I swim. Amazing headset
customer_reviews.author: deana

customer_reviews.title: Good concept. Not Apple compatible
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t support Apple iTunes so to use it I would have had to repurchase my entire library. Wasn’t able to convert the files. While I like the concept I had to return it
customer_reviews.author: SumPerzen

customer_reviews.title: Reliable while swimming
customer_reviews.text: Helps relieve the boredom of swimming laps. Although the music reproduction is not perfect employing bone conduction, I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: Wearing it behind your ears works great.
customer_reviews.text: I've swam with this quite a bit and love it. I wear it tucked behind my ears in my cap. This way works really well. I don't fiddle with it on my goggles. I've put a ton of music on it and it's nowhere near full. Put it on shuffle and go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: If you asked me a week ago, I would have given 5 stars, however, 10 months after purchasing my Underwater MP3 player no longer works. It will not hook up to transfer music nor will it connect for a charge. After contacting the company, they helped troubleshoot the issue and when troubleshooting didn't work, they honored their warranty policy and replaced my underwater headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: The Best Solution--No More Boring Swims!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Fantastic! Where have these been all of my swimming life? I bought these after I was disappointed by the insert-in-ear-canal earbuds (poor seal against water, poor sound) and the waterproof iPod. This Duo Underwater MP3 Player works great, especially while my head is in the water (my head is out of the water only to breathe). I download podcasts on to my computer and transfer two weeks of material (six, one-hour shows) to the Duo. The Duo makes my hour-long swims go by quickly--no more boring swims!
customer_reviews.author: MMMMMM

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if they didn't feel so lose against my face ...
customer_reviews.text: Let's me listen to music while swimming making my workouts enjoyable. I am new to bone conducting tech and did not realize that everyone would be able to hear it when I'm not underwater. I'm a bit self conscious about disturbing others but so far, no one has complained. Would be nice if they didn't feel so lose against my face but something I can get used to. Overall, I'm relatively happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: good for swimming
customer_reviews.text: love swimming with these. There should be a gizmo to help wearing them without goggles, outside of the water, or when not using goggles. The volume setting interferes with the forwarding action some times, particularly if adjusting when already on. Battery life is shorter than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: The connecting point is weak and now the wire inside is exposed
customer_reviews.text: I am initially really happy with the product. To be fair it is the only music player that works really well in the water, even compared to the dash from Bragi. But after three months of usage, the wire inside is exposed where the cable is connected to the side part. It is frustrating because it is a product that's supposed to work in water. And I only swim twice a week at most. And I tried to protect it really well. I used some liquid electrical tape to kind of cover it up. However I really don't know how long it is going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Liu Xuefei

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for over 2 years now. Typically I swim pool laps and am I the water an hour 2-4 times a week. About a year in to its use the charger broke. I contacted the company and they sent a replacement free of charge. I have had no problems with loading music. I love this design over ear buds because every time I took a stroke the ear bud popped out. I spent more time adjusting than swimming. I don’t spend anytime adjusting these. I have also used them in saltwater occasionally without any problems. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: it took me awhile to figure out where the best place on the goggles was to place it so ...
customer_reviews.text: it took me awhile to figure out where the best place on the goggles was to place it so that it didn't affect the goggles on turns but after that it works fine. i have a Mac computer so I had to figure out how to change my music to MP3 mode but I have my complete playlist on it now. Makes swimming much less boring. I'll often tell myself, okay, one more song before I stop!
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Love the Duo.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these once, but the sound is fantastic. A little bulky and takes some getting use to, but once I did I did not want to get out of the water. Love not having to deal with headphones as I did with my Ipod, where I was adjusting them constantly. Once I got the Duo set, I could keep on swimming. Definitely recommend as it is a game changer if you want to increase your time in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Kyrstin Lavelle

customer_reviews.title: No more swimmer's ear!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other underwater MP3 players with earbuds that go in the ear canal. However these inevitably become dislodged and repositioning them just jams water in your ear canal causing the sound to be distorted and sometimes swimmers ear. This product stays in place, the sound quality is excellent, and I never have to adjust it throughout the whole swim. I have found that it works best when you wear earplugs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Wires broken within 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first pair and they worked fine for about a year and then simply stopped. Thought maybe I did not take good care of them enough so bought another set in January and took good care of them. The battery life was poor and now both wires have simply broken off each of the bone condensing speaker phones. Very dissapointed as I wanted these to work well and prefer not to go buy the MP3 players with ear buds. No guarantees or returns on the finis as well so now in trash.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: Battery Defective
customer_reviews.text: Battery will not hold a charge more than a few days. Manual indicates that the battery should last at least 7 hours with a full charge. I swim for an hour a few days a week. After two one-hour swims, the device is dead. I'm waiting for a response from customer service.
customer_reviews.author: archie f.

customer_reviews.title: The best music player for swimmers, hands down
customer_reviews.text: I've had a set of these since 2012 which finally died, so these were a replacement. Except, everything's been upgraded: - better, clearer, louder sound - better, easier to use controls - better charging system (the magnetic dock works great) The best swimming music player has gotten better!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bower

customer_reviews.title: good alternative to earplugs
customer_reviews.text: works well, but of course it looks weird - so people ask about it a lot. Volume varies and gets immediately softer when you lift your head out of the water, or when you turn your head to one side to breath, taking one speaker out of the water. But I like these and do recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Not fantastic for active/exercise swimming.
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound... if you’re not moving much. If you’re a diver or like underwater basket weaving this would be great, but if you’re a swimmer I really can’t say that this works all that great. Durable, yes... decent sound when there’s no air or splashing in the mix. Yup. Freestyle stroke... not so much.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Loving my headset so far
customer_reviews.text: Only used it a few times but so far so good. It does take a while for me to adjust the headset on my googles. The sound quality is good and its easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Better to wait for technology to improve
customer_reviews.text: Bought Finis 3 months ago. As with many other buyers, unit will not take charge. Based on reviews of product & manufacturer response, not going to bother with return even though it was a relatively expensive toy for 3 months use. Weirdly, this seems to be top rated brand for swimming, but issues of water corrosion and charging difficulties need to be better addressed. Will not be looking for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Potential but goggles leak
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it twice, but my goggles leak. The sound quality seems the best compared to other headsets I've tried, but I can only get half way through a length before the goggles leak. I've tried moving the headset more back on the goggles, still no luck. I'll try once more, but otherwise will need to return. If these to be worn with specific goggles, the goggles should be included with the headset!
customer_reviews.author: IthacaPeople

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times and although the sound quality is great, the dock and software are awful. Like many others have commented, my computer no longer recognizes the device. In addition the dock itself is very poorly engineered. Expensive for just a few laps worth of swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Vlo

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I listen to podcasts when I swim ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I listen to podcasts when I swim and sound quality is excellent. I also listen when I am out of the pool and that works, too. I've had mine a year now with no issues. Previous versions of these players were hit and miss; think the duo finally resolved some of the issues they were having. I'm going to order another just to have one available when/if the current one fails. Can't really swim without one now!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best mp3 player.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this finis mp3 for about a year....I enjoy having the music while I swim laps. I use it about 5 times a week. I have used many finis mp3 players through the years and this one is the best one that I have had. You know how swimming laps can be so boring but this helps so much
customer_reviews.author: B. pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: This product is flawed. I used it about 5-6 times for a total of 3 hrs and the battery died. It won’t charge and Amazon states it is past the 30 day return window, so they referred me to Finis which is open to 3:00 pm Monday through Friday. Would not commend either the Finis MP 3 player or purchasing from Amazon as there is no customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Meg R

customer_reviews.title: Happy in general with the product
customer_reviews.text: Happy in general with the product. It is my second Finis MP3 (1st served me for 3 years until the electrical wire connecting the 2 parts Eroded and tore apart) - and the new one also works fine. I liked better the clip that mounts on the goggles in the older product: the new one was strengthened and hardened in order to produce a more firm connection to the goggles, but it now takes me longer to mount it on the goggles and take it off, and after about 10 times - it already started to show accelerated wearing of the goggles' strap...
customer_reviews.author: Chepperes Fialkov

customer_reviews.title: charging issues
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several other finis underwater mp3 players and they all worked great for about a year before crapping out. With the technology and price that didn't seem too bad of a deal for me, though. This generation/model has been a complete nightmare right from purchase, though. I try to charge it and my computer won't recognize it. I unplug and re-plug until it's finally recognized and the green light blinks to show it's charging. When I come back to my computer a few hours later my entire computer is frozen and I have to hard restart, then the mp3 isn't even charged after all of that. I absolutely hate this version.
customer_reviews.author: Alison B. Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with all goggles
customer_reviews.text: I've only just got my Finis bone conduction MP3 player, so this review won't be complete yet, but I do want to warn you - it does not fit all swim goggles. I have Speedo goggles, and the player units, which go under the strap on both sides of the head, are so thick that they pull the goggles away from my head, so that water gets in. Musically the player seems to work fine, definitely better than any of the earphones I had before, but it's annoying that I now have to replace my goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Is the wire seperation normal?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair in 6 months and the same thing has happened both times so I am wondering if this is normal? The last pair would not charge. I swim everyday-125 miles first 2 months of this year-and really enjoy the music but have not had much luck with this design. I take proper care of these and feedback is appreciated. I had 3 pairs of the older models that were blue and they lasted about 3.5 years each. Rod Young Oregon OH
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Swimming MPS
customer_reviews.text: Great product. If you swim a lot, this is a product that will you will want to use every time!
customer_reviews.author: VY

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept but liked the older model better
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept but liked the older model better. I have used this probably about 10 times and the connection no longer works to get it to download music from the computer. Very frustrating, never had this problem with the last one.
customer_reviews.author: babs strauss

customer_reviews.title: Great sound underwater!
customer_reviews.text: Love this equipment! Nicely designed and safe and easy to use! I get a lot of questions when I swim at the Y here. New customers on the way! Not so easy to program and it felt like the tech guys on the line we’re learning with me. They did not have answers I needed but were willing to experiment together. In the end, I found the solution without him! All in all, I am very happy with the Finis Duo!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

product_meta.title: FINIS Duo Underwater Bone Conduction MP3 Player
feature_bullets: BONE CONDUCTION AUDIO TRANSMISSION: Amazingly clear sound in the water without the use of ear buds
SUPPORTS MP3 AND WMA AUDIO FORMATS: Compatible with iTunes; listen to music, audiobooks, podcasts, and more
4GB OF STORAGE: Stores approximately up to 1000 songs or 60 hours of playback; Mac OS Users: Please empty the Trash on your computer before connecting the Duo to the USB
INTEGRATED CLIP DESIGN: Secures the device to goggle straps to rest on the cheekbones for a comfortable and streamlined fit
WATERPROOF IPX8: Up to 3 meters and 30 minutes; sound is clearest when submerged in water

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
